meanings.definition: Physical suffering or discomfort caused by illness or injury.
meanings.sent1: The sharp pain in my leg made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: She winced in pain as the nurse cleaned her wound.
meanings.sent3: The pain in my back from sitting too long is a reminder to take breaks.
meanings.sent4: The pain of losing a loved one is like a heavy weight on the heart.
meanings.sent5: The throbbing pain in my head felt like a hammer striking repeatedly.

meanings.definition: Mental or emotional suffering or distress.
meanings.sent1: Her heart was filled with pain after the breakup.
meanings.sent2: The pain of loneliness can be overwhelming at times.
meanings.sent3: Finding out I missed the concert tickets was a real pain.
meanings.sent4: The pain of betrayal cut deep into her trust.
meanings.sent5: The pain of rejection lingered long after the interview.

meanings.definition: A feeling of distress or unease.
meanings.sent1: The pain in her stomach before the exam was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sharp pain in his chest when he heard the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The pain of uncertainty gnawed at her throughout the day.
meanings.sent4: The pain of regret weighed heavily on his mind.
meanings.sent5: The pain of indecision paralyzed her ability to choose.
